conclusion: Need to analyze the graph to understand the relationship between terminal voltage U and current I.
Line a represents the U-I characteristic of the silicon photocell.
Line b represents the U-I characteristic of a resistor R.
When components are in series, total voltage is the sum of voltages across each component.
The intersection of lines a and b indicates the operating point of the circuit.
Intersection point: Current (I) is 0.2 A, Voltage (U) is 2.5 V.
Line b is a straight line through the origin, indicating a linear relationship characteristic of a resistor.
The slope of line b gives the resistance R: R = 2.5 V / 0.2 A = 12.5 Ω.
Voltage across the resistor R is 2.5 V at the intersection point.
Voltage across the silicon photocell must also be 2.5 V at the intersection point.
Current through the silicon photocell is 0.2 A.
Using Ohm's law for the silicon photocell: R_internal = 2.5 V / 0.2 A = 12.5 Ω.
The internal resistance of the silicon photocell is 12.5 Ω.
